title: AKA defends Zuma: He's always stood for empowering black people
text:
AKA said that corruption was a way of life in South Africa and admitted that he had "flourished" during Zuma's presidency. Under Jacob Zuma's government I've flourished the land has been fertile, the opportunities endless .... VIVA ANC VIVA!!! — AKA (@akaworldwide) February 9, 2017 When Twitter dragged him over his comment, he hit back by saying the money he got from the ANC was not even enough to match what he would normally make in one night, Y'all can sing for your supper tweet me Everything the ANC directly paid me in history I made up on stage at Kong last week. — AKA (@akaworldwide) February 9, 2017 
The rapper's comments got a lot of his followers feeling touched and they flooded his page with messages and memes calling him "arrogant" and "corrupt". 
He hit back but in the end had one piece of advice for his haters: make it happen for yourself Blah blah blah ... just be happy, drink wine, work hard & do your best for yourself and your family? Ok? Sharp.
